moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 Nf6: The makings of the Two Knights defense... Normal theory, concerning this opening, extends to moves like 3. ... Bc5 4. c3 Nf6 5. d4 exd4 6. cxd4 Bb4+ 7. Bd2...
moves.4. Ng5: As Fischer once stated, the best way to crack this, is 4. d4 exd4 5. e5 Ng4 6. 0-0, and see what happens... I always like to toy a bit, with this...
moves.4... d5: Forced... After Bc5?? (Traxler??), Nxf7, Qe7, Nxh8... So much for Traxler...
moves.5. exd5 Nxd5: This, however, is not forced... 5. ... Na5 6. Bb5+ c6 7. dxc6 bxc6 8. Qf3!, leads to the Blackburne variation... After Nd4, d6!, after b5?, Bf1!, Qxd5 (else Bxb5), Nc3, followed by Bxb5...
moves.6. Nxf7: Without further a due... Even at this point, white can play 6. d4... There are no attacks, white can castle, and has the initiative... This, however, is a sacrifice... Do not try this without further guidance...
moves.6... Kxf7 7. Qf3+ Ke6: The only way, to justify accepting white's sac... After 7. ... Qf6 8. Bxd5, with check...
moves.9... c6: The only continuation, that will not lose immediately... Nb5 threatens also...
moves.10... Kd7: Natural, but incorrect... Square f7 gets unprotected... Furthermore, placing a King in front of a Queen is never wise... 10. ... Qe8 wil just hold, after 11. 0-0 Qf7 12. Qd1...
moves.13... Kc6: After 13. ... Kb6, follows the disconcerning 14. Qb3, after 13. ... Kb8, 14. e6 Bxe6 15. Qc3...
moves.14. c4: When there is a crack, there is light inside... My favourite chess wisdom...
moves.14... h6: Nothing works, anymore... After 14. ... Be6 15. Nd4+ Kd7 16. 0-0...
moves.15. Rc1: Let's take him out of his misery...
moves.15... Kd7 16. e6+ Kxe6: Ke8, Qf7 mate... Kc6, cxd5++, Kxb5 (forced), Qd3+...
moves.17. cxd5+: Threatens Nc7+, as well as Nd4+... Ke5 leads to mate...
moves.17... Kd7 18. Rc7+: Totally winning now, is the prozaic 18. 0-0! hxg5 19. d6!!, followed by Qf7... But this is also winning...
moves.18... Qxc7: After Ke8, Bh4!, followed by d6...

gameName: Final analysis over the Two Knights Defense
opening: two knights defence (C57), Fegatello attack, Polerio defence
